title: Support Engineer, Python (Relocate To Bangkok)
job_function: Engineering, Product Management, and Project Management
company_industry: Software Development and IT System Custom Software Development
description:
**Manatal** 
 is an HRTech software service (B2B SaaS) company headquartered in Bangkok, Thailand. Manatal is one of the fastest-growing start-ups in the region and is backed by Surge and Sequoia Capital. Manatal has a global presence and is trusted by thousands of businesses in over 135 countries and is recognized by Forbes as Best Recruiting Software of 2024.
 



 Our goal is to transform the entire hiring process by making it simple, efficient, and enjoyable for recruiters, hiring managers, and candidates alike.
 



 Our mission is to offer best-in-class AI-powered technologies to empower small, medium, and large businesses in their staffing & recruitment transformation.
 



  





**Role Overview** 




 Customers are at the center of Manatal, and so are you as our Support Engineer. You are the bridge between our Customer Success (CS) and Product/Engineering teams to enhance the customer experience throughout their whole Manatal journey. For this, you will partner with our CS team and clients in over 130 countries to resolve their troubles & propose new ways to better leverage Manatal for their needs.
 



  





**Responsibilities** 



* Partner with our Customer Success team over complex technical challenges to provide the best support to our clients
* Assist clients with their onboarding to Manatal by preparing data migration projects (analyzing the data and proposing the best way to import the data into Manatal)
* Support the Customer Success team by joining client calls to provide clients with recommendations on how to best leverage Manatal for their needs (e.g. API integrations, etc.)
* Liaise with the internal team to improve the customer experience (design, functionality, process) based on customer feedback
* Liaise with the Product team for vetting incoming product requests by clients to ensure we continuously enhance Manatal based on deep customer understanding



  





**Requirements** 



* Fluency in English (written and verbal)
* Experience working in a product or support role with a technical foundation
* Strong exposure to customers and managed independently customer calls for resolving complex technical issues or product questions
* Empathy for customers to understand their problems and translate them into engineering and product requests
* The ability to learn quickly and grow product knowledge steadily to best advise clients to leverage Manatal to the fullest
* Hands-on experience with debugging complex technical issues
* 1+ years of experience using Python scripts to automate data migrations
* Experience with APIs (understanding how APIs work, understanding how to leverage API integrations for enhancing the customer's workflows)
* Experience with Databases (Postgres, MySQL, Microsoft SQL Server) for analyzing large datasets
* Experience working with Jira and Jira Service Desk for internal team communication



  





**Nice to have** 



* Experience with Postman for debugging API-related issues
* Experience working with Intercom and Hubspot for client communication
* Experience with Mailgun & Sendgrid for troubleshooting emailing issues



  





**Working with Manatal** 



* This role is based at our Bangkok office in the heart of the city center
* As a team of diverse cultures and nationalities, English language proficiency is required
* We enjoy collaborating in person and the team is working on-site



  





**Why you'll enjoy working with Manatal** 



* Well-funded start-up backed by Surge & Sequoia
* Be part of one of the fastest-growing B2B SaaS start-ups in the region
* You will be collaborating with talented individuals in the industry
* Join a lively and highly international team
* Indulge in a challenging and innovative working culture
* Attractive medical healthcare plan
* Personal development allowance
* 2 weeks of work from anywhere per year
* Regular fun team-building activities
* Company trip



  





**Watch our Demo** 




 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-GG1GqXkAKQ
 



 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VjinpYMUMoc
 



  





**Manatal Hiring** 




 At Manatal, we are dedicated to building an intuitive, AI-powered application tracking system to streamline and transform the entire hiring and recruitment process.
 



 We are devoted to attracting the best talent worldwide to join our team and take pride in being an equal-opportunity workplace. We are committed to equal employment opportunities regardless of religion, race, ethnicity, ancestry, national origin, gender, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, marital or parental status, disability, age, citizenship, or other class protected by applicable law.

title: SIEM- infrastrukturspecialist
description:
Är du redo för en större uppgift? Polismyndigheten är Sveriges största myndighet med ca 40 000 medarbetare över hela landet. Hos oss får du möjlighet att bidra till polisens uppdrag – att öka tryggheten och minska brottsligheten i samhället.
   

  

 Arbetsplatsbeskrivning
   

  

 IT-avdelningens främsta uppgift är att tillhandahålla IT-tjänster till hela Polismyndigheten. IT-avdelningen en viktig del av det brottsförebyggande och brottsbekämpande arbetet och IT är ett av de viktigaste verktygen för att effektivisera polisen och öka kvaliteten i polisarbetet. IT-avdelningen utvecklar och moderniserar polisens IT och myndigheten satsar mycket på att stärka avdelningen med ny specialistkompetens och den senaste teknologin till nytta för medborgarna och medarbetarna i den polisiära verksamheten.
   

  

 Arbetsbeskrivning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten söker nu efter en SIEM-infrastrukturspecialist (Security Information & Event Management) som ska ingå i en av våra grupper på IT-säkerhetssektionen.
   

  

 Sektionen IT-säkerhet består av flertalet grupper och har bland annat nationellt funktionsansvar för informations- och IT-säkerhet samt signalskydd.
   

  

 IT-säkerhetssektionen ger stöd till utveckling och förvaltning, ansvarar för att genomföra säkerhetstester, granskning och uppföljning av IT-säkerheten. Bland uppgifterna ingår också process- och funktionsansvar för identitets- och åtkomsthantering, säkerhetsövervakning, incidentutredning m.m.
   

  

 Gruppen består av it-säkerhetsanalytiker och SIEM-infrastrukturspecialister. Gruppens huvuduppgift är att skydda all polisens information och IT-system, mot såväl interna som externa hot. Gruppen säkerställer att vi utvecklar våra plattformar i rätt riktning baserat på omvärldsanalys och behov inom myndigheten.
   

  

 SIEM-infrastrukturspecialistens roll är att underhålla och vidareutveckla plattformarna för insamling och analys av logg från polisens hela IT-miljö. En av plattformarna används av exempelvis polisens SOC (Security Operations Center).
   

  

 Du kommer att arbeta med:
   

  

* att analysera nya tekniska möjligheter för att vidareutveckla plattformarna anslutningar av polisens olika IT-system till vår centrala logganalysmiljö
* att ansvara för uppgraderingar och förändringar i vår miljö
* utformning och utveckling av rapporter, övervakningsregler och larm i vårt logganalysverktyg, detta för att bistå utredningar och övervakning inom polisen
* vägledning i form av att bistå med stöd mot andra förvaltningar och systemutvecklingsprojekt i frågor som rör loggning i polisens applikationer, operativsystem, databashanterare och komponenter


 Kvalifikationer
   

  

**Detta är en möjlighet för dig som har:**
* flerårig erfarenhet av SIEM-verktyg och logghantering (exempelvis Elastic, Splunk, ArcSight eller QRadar)
* mycket goda kunskaper inom IT-infrastruktur, exempelvis applikationer, system och databaser, köhanterare samt operativsystemen Windows och Linux
* goda kunskaper i programmering av hjälpverktyg i Python, Bash eller Powershell
* mycket goda kunskaper i svenska, både i tal och skrift
* svenskt medborgarskap


**Det är meriterande om du även har:**
* erfarenheter av att arbeta som lösningsarkitekt
* erfarenheter av logghantering och logganalyser inom högsäkerhetsorganisationer
* mångårig erfarenhet av logghantering inom system, applikationer, databaser och operativsystem
* certifiering inom IT-säkerhet eller informationssäkerhet


**Personliga egenskaper**
 Vi söker dig som gillar att lära nytt och har en ständig strävan att bli riktigt bra i din profession med stort fokus på leverans. Du är lyhörd och noggrann och värnar om ett gott samarbetsklimat. Du delar med dig av din kunskap, kommer med förbättringsförslag och idéer samt är prestigelös. Du är engagerad och driven och tycker om att samarbeta både inom teamet, men även mot andra team och verksamheter. Vi kommer att lägga stor vikt vid personliga egenskaper.
   

  

 Beskrivning av arbetsplatsen
   

  

 IT-avdelningens främsta uppgift är att tillhandahålla IT-tjänster till hela Polismyndigheten. IT-avdelningen en viktig del av det brottsförebyggande och brottsbekämpande arbetet och IT är ett av de viktigaste verktygen för att effektivisera polisen och öka kvaliteten i polisarbetet. IT-avdelningen utvecklar och moderniserar polisens IT och myndigheten satsar mycket på att stärka avdelningen med ny specialistkompetens och den senaste teknologin till nytta för medborgarna och medarbetarna i den polisiära verksamheten.
   

  

 Kontaktpersoner
   

  

 Har du frågor om uppdraget är du välkommen att kontakta rekryterande chef: 0722- 379 377
   

  

 Har du frågor gällande rekryteringsprocessen kontakta ansvarig HR-konsult:
   

  

 Kimberly Uvelid, kimberly.uvelid@polisen.se
   

  

 Fackliga företrädare
   

  

 Polisförbundet, Sofia Ask, tfn: 010-563 87 10
   

  

 SACO, nås via mejl saco-s.avdelningarna@polisen.se
   

  

 SEKO Polisen, Karna Tillheden, tfn: 010-561 66 27
   

  

 ST, Jessica Stålenkrans 010-563 32 66
   

  

 Övrig information
   

  

 Anställningsform: Tillsvidareanställning
   

  

 Anställningsbenämning: Handläggare
   

  

 Arbetsort: Stockholm
   

  

 Arbetstid: Flexibel arbetstid
   

  

 Tillträde: Enligt överenskommelse
   

  

 Funktion: Teknikspecialist
   

  

 Ansök genom att bifoga ditt CV (vi vill inte ha något personligt brev) och besvara urvalsfrågorna. Frågorna utgår från kravprofilen för den här rekryteringen och dina svar ligger till grund för det urval som sker i processen. Att besvara frågorna är en förutsättning för att din ansökan ska anses komplett.
   

  

 Vänligen notera att krav och eventuella meriter ska vara uppfyllda vid ansökningstillfället.
   

  

 De uppgifter du lämnar i samband med din ansökan kan användas för att kontakta dig, få information och kallelser samt eventuella anställningshandlingar.
   

  

**Välkommen med din ansökan i form av CV och enkät (PDF) (pdf, 170 kB) via e-post till jobb.na@polisen.se senast den 22 april 2025** 
 . Ansökningar till denna befattning kommer endast tas emot via den mailadress som anges i annonsen.
 **Märk din ansökan med referensnummer A185.037/2025 i mailets ärendemening.**
 Har du skyddade personuppgifter, referenser eller liknande information som du själv bedömer som skyddsvärd rekommenderar vi att du kontaktar ansvarig HR-konsult innan du går vidare med din ansökan.
   

  

 En anställning hos Polismyndigheten kan komma att inledas med en provanställning om sex månader.
   

  

 Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetenhet. Säkerhetsprövning med registerkontroll enligt säkerhetsskyddslagen (2018:585) genomförs innan beslut om anställning fattas. Med anställning följer en skyldighet att krigsplaceras. Läs mer om krigsplacering och säkerhetsprövning under https://polisen.se/krigsplacering och https://polisen.se/sakerhetsprovning
   

  

 Polismyndigheten kommer att behandla dina personuppgifter i enlighet med reglerna i EU:s dataskyddsförordning (2016/679) och annan tillämplig dataskyddsreglering. Läs mer om vår hantering av personuppgifter på https://polisen.se/personuppgifter/rekrytering
   

  

 Din ansökan är en allmän handling enligt offentlighetsprincipen.
   

  

**Polismyndigheten**

 Vi bedriver vår verksamhet enligt vår värdegrund: engagemang, effektivitet och tillgänglighet. Som medarbetare inom polisen agerar du för likabehandling. Det är en förutsättning för rättssäkerhet, rättstrygghet och för polisens legitimitet i samhället. Som företrädare för polisen respekterar du allas lika värde och skapar förtroende för polisen. Läs gärna mer om polisen och vår verksamhet på www.polisen.se
   

 www.polisen.se

 Vi undanber oss samtal och mejl från dig som vill sälja annons- och rekryteringstjänster.

title: Director Backend
company_industry: Technology, Information and Media and Software Development
description:
**International p/e-backed SaaS group with roots/legacy from Sweden** 




 Dynamic media is at the core of how we communicate and share stories today. From global corporations to local startups, organizations rely on creative and effective content to engage their audiences. This SaaS company focuses on improving the media industry with practical solutions for video and dynamic media. By offering tools that simplify workflows and enhance collaboration, it helps businesses adapt and operate efficiently in a constantly evolving digital landscape. With headquarters in the USA and around 230 employees worldwide, the company operates globally. Its Stockholm office, centrally located, serves as an important hub for two key brands.
 



  





 The company serves three key markets: media and entertainment, broadcast and sports, and corporate brands. Its tools support everything from pre-production and live event broadcasting to recruitment and marketing. Known for its open ecosystem, the company’s solutions integrate seamlessly with existing workflows, offering flexibility and scalability for businesses of all sizes.
 



  





**The role** 




 The Director Backend is responsible for leading the direction and execution of the backend and platform development and maintenance, ensuring solutions meet the organization’s evolving needs and future growth. This role will involve overseeing all developers working with backend development, driving high-quality, scalable, and secure software solutions that align with broader company goals. This person will collaborate closely with the CTO, product managers, other senior leaders, and the executive team to shape and execute software development strategies that support business objectives. As a key senior leader within the engineering organization, this position will establish and champion best practices in architecture, coding standards, and agile methodologies.
 



  





**Areas of responsibilities** 



* Lead and mentor developers and work with the Directors and other managers to foster a high-performance culture that emphasizes collaboration, innovation, and quality.
* Oversee and strategically guide the design, development, and delivery of software solutions that align with organizational goals and exceed customer expectations.
* Drive complex architecture and system design discussions to ensure solutions are scalable, secure, and high-performing, supporting the organization’s long-term vision.
* Work with the CTO to create and maintain budgets for the engineering organization.
* Collaborate with senior stakeholders to define and execute software development roadmaps, prioritizing initiatives that align with broader company objectives.
* Build and sustain strong relationships with key stakeholders, including product management, Infrastructure teams, and executive leadership, fostering alignment on strategic goals.
* Champion the use of modern development methodologies (e.g. Agile, Kanban, Scrum) and tools, ensuring efficient project management and delivery.
* Oversee incident management, troubleshooting, and resolution of critical production issues.
* Keep teams updated on the latest trends in technology and development best practices, particularly in areas relevant to frontend, backend, cloud services, and security.



  





**Key Skills & Qualifications** 



* Extensive experience leading software development teams in a SaaS or technology-driven environment.
* Strong expertise in backend technologies (e.g., Python, Go, etc.).
* Strong expertise in API development, web services, and system architecture for large-scale applications.
* Experience working with databases (SQL and NoSQL) and ensuring high performance and reliability.
* Proficiency with cloud services (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and modern infrastructure practices like containerization (Docker, Kubernetes).
* Significant experience with version control systems such as Git and GitHub.
* Significant experience implementing agile development processes and overseeing large software projects from conception to delivery.
* Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to foster collaboration across teams.
* Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail, with the ability to handle complex technical challenges.
* Experience in SaaS product development and a strong understanding of business-to-business software solutions.



  





**There is more!** 




 The company is backed by a leading growth equity firm specializing in innovative software and technology. In 2022, the company acquired five complementary media technology companies. These acquisitions have created a unified suite of tools covering every stage of the content lifecycle: from scripting and editing to storage, collaboration, and distribution.
 



  





 With support from the equity owner and under the guidance of a visionary CEO, the company is building a unified identity, streamlining operations, and focusing on sustained growth. With award-winning brands recognized globally for their contributions to the media industry, the organization is at the forefront of redefining the future of media technology.
 



  





**How to apply** 




 In this recruitment process, the company is partnering up with Academic Search International. You apply by clicking the ”Apply now” button, where you enter your personal details and enclose CV written in English. We work with continuous selection and kindly ask you to submit your application as soon as possible.
 



  





 For questions, please contact Managing Consultant Arnold Sjölund at +46 (0)70 650 31 18 or arnold.sjolund@academicsearch.se or Researcher Amelia Kämpeberg at +46(0)73 650 31 57 or amelia.kampeberg@academicsearch.se
 



  





 All information is handled confidentially in accordance with Academic Search Integrity Policy as well as the new data protection act, GDPR. This means that we can only process applications coming through the applications system. Thank you for your understanding.

title: Technical Frontend Architect to growing SaaS-company
description:
**About The Role**
 Tacton is looking for a Front-end Architect to guide the technical direction of our B2B, CPQ SaaS platform. In this position, you will take on significant responsibility in setting priorities, defining best practices and technology choices ensuring continuous successful software product deliveries. We are a leader in Gartners Magic Quadrant for CPQ and our product is unique, demanding a high level of collaboration across the product teams and cross component alignment. You’ll work closely with our exceptionally skilled architect team and the agile development teams, today consisting of 30 senior developers. You will refine and shape the future of our state-of-the-art scalable SaaS solution with focus on front-end technologies.  As our R&D department evolves, we're looking for someone who brings a forward-thinking mindset.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Technical Direction & Prioritization – Shape the overall front-end architectural vision while ensuring scalability and maintainability. Translate business goals into practical solutions that drive long-term success.
* Architect & Implement – Design and implement robust, cloud-native solutions for our front-end initiatives and projects together with the development teams. Leverage your comprehensive front-end and/or full-stack development expertise to ensure the right long term front-end architecture is maintained in our SaaS product and projects are delivered successful.
* Operational Coordination – Work closely with the Product Management team to align development efforts with business objectives. Document architectural decisions to provide clarity and consistency across teams.
* Cross-Functional Collaboration – Work hand-in-hand with product design and development teams to streamline CI/CD pipelines and deployment workflows. Effectively articulate technical challenges and solutions in a clear and constructive way.
* Continuous Improvement – Stay ahead of SaaS, cloud (AWS), and relevant frontend technologies, identifying opportunities to enhance platform performance, user experience, code quality, maintainability, security, and scalability.


**Qualifications**
**Who are you:**
* 10 + years of experience in front-end or full stack SaaS software development, ideally within a SaaS software product company.
* Strong architectural mindset, identifying synergies across product areas driving our end to end front-end architecture in the desired strategical direction incrementally.
* A willingness to engage in full stack architectural discussions and projects when needed.
* An open-minded team player who values discussion over rigid solutions - you listen, adapt, and collaborate well with your colleagues.
* Proven track record in architecting and developing SaaS solutions (CPQ experience is a plus).
* Expertise in cloud environments (AWS).
* Front-end development expertise. Currently we are mainly using JavaScript, TypeScript, Preact, and in-house front-end frameworks, but part of the role is to continuously oversee that we are using the right tools for the job.
* Fluent in English; Swedish is a plus.
* We believe in real-time collaboration and prefer you to be on-site three days a week, at our Stockholm office, to foster direct knowledge sharing and innovation.


**The Recruitment Process Consists Of**
* Screening call with Talent Acquisition
* First interview with our hiring manager
* Technical interview/ case
* Interview with our CPO, CTO or COO
* Logical and personality online tests
* Reference check


**Why Tacton?**
* Tacton is the global leader in Gartners Magic Quadrant for CPQ
* Stability & Growth – With over 20 years in the CPQ space and strong, committed ownership, we invest in long-term success.
* Technical Impact – Play a key role in shaping architectural decisions and driving the evolution of our B2B SaaS CPQ platform.
* Collaborative Team – Work alongside highly skilled senior developers in an environment that values learning, knowledge-sharing, and innovation.
* Comprehensive Benefits – Enjoy a competitive benefits package designed to support your well-being and work-life balance.


**Our Culture and Why You Belong**
 Collaborative, Engaged, Trustworthy, Customer-Oriented, Visionary—if these values resonate with you, we’d love to hear from you!
   

  

 At Tacton, we celebrate diversity and strive to create an inclusive environment where everyone feels welcome. Our team consists of people from all over the world, and we believe this diversity makes us stronger.
   

  

 As an Equal Opportunity Employer, we’re committed to fostering an environment where everyone can thrive. With our comprehensive onboarding program, you’ll be set up for success from day one.
   

  

 We look forward to your application—apply soon as we review candidates on a rolling basis.
   

  

**About Tacton**
*Tacton is a leading Software as a Service company trusted by global manufacturers. We got started in the late 1990’s when six computer scientists figured out a revolutionary way to help Manufacturers overcome their most business-critical, product configuration challenges. Since those early days, we have grown to support global manufacturers seeking to thrive in a changing world.*
*We invite you to find out more about us @ www.tacton.com/about*
 Tacton is a leading SaaS company within CPQ and Design Automation making sales simple for complex products.

title: Senior Solution Architect PLM
description:
**Siemens Digital Industries Software** 
 is a leading provider of solutions for the design, simulation, and manufacture of products across many different industries. Formula 1 cars, skyscrapers, ships, space exploration vehicles, and many of the objects we see in our daily lives are being conceived and manufactured using our Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) software.
   

  

**The Nordic Service organization** 
 focuses on high profile companies in the Nordic region and together with them, we build ground-breaking solutions allowing faster time-to-market and higher product quality. We have many new customers taking their first steps with us, as well as longtime clients taking their next step in the digital transformation, so we need to grow our team extensively.
   

  

 Customer stories - https://www.plm.automation.siemens.com/global/en/our-story/customers/#/?country=SE
   

  

**Your mission**
 If you are in the business, you have heard all the buzz words like
 **PLM/ALM/SLM, Digital Twins, CLM, CLQ, TIA, MBSE, SaaS, IoT, MES/MOM** 
 , and many more. In this job these buzz words come to life – they go from marketing slogans to successfully implemented solutions deployed in complex customer scenarios. And you can be one of the main players making this happen. Every customer journey will be unique, and you will have the opportunity to work in all or many phases of a customer engagement.
   

  

 You can expect to
   

  

* Support the strategic Sales team, providing guidance on architecture options and the long-term roadmap for the solution in early phases of a client engagement
* During the development phase, translate business requirements into specific process-based solution design based on industry domain knowledge and best practices in the subject area, allowing customers to use the full potential of our software
* Lead a Solution Design or Implementation team when required
* Act as the ultimate authority on architectural design to address business problems
* Mentor and coach less experienced colleagues
* Occasionally consult on strategic and/or complex Enterprise projects in the Nordics, of diverse scope that require specialist expertise and high levels of technical leadership


**The team**
 We are a consulting community of 30 highly skilled professionals working primarily with our
 **Lifecycle Management solutions, mainly Teamcenter. The team is spread over two sites in Sweden, Stockholm and Gothenburg area, and one site in Denmark, Vejle area.**
 The community is organized in smaller teams, so that every team member has a team leader who guides and coaches them in their development. Our offices are in Solna, Mölndal and Vejle where we meet and collaborate with colleagues. We also meet regularly online within the teams and as a community to share competence and experiences across the Nordics.
   

  

 When we work on customer projects, we are backed by the full power of the Siemens organization, with everything from easily available training resources, product information, access to product managers and other specialists, and access to and services colleagues from around the world. Siemens is a learning company, and a place where we share information to enable our colleagues.
   

  

 As Solution Architect you thrive in collaborative environments while being the point of contact between the customer, the users, and the development teams. You enjoy meeting new people, companies, industries, and products, and take pride in delivering innovative solutions as a team.
   

  

 We look for a great teammate, knowledge sharing is second nature to you. You may already in your current position mentor or coach colleagues, and from time to time take a project role as leader for a smaller team.
   

  

 You master English, and preferably a Nordic language, on a professional level and have excellent presentation skills and can present complex topics to different audiences. You are eager to learn new technologies and to stay up to date with the development in the industry.
   

  

**Your Qualifications**
* Consolidated experience working as Solution Architect within Product Lifecycle Management (PLM), preferably Teamcenter
* Experience as SA within mid to large PLM projects
* Understanding of business processes and challenges within digitalization
* Proven leadership skills
* Stakeholder management skills


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience with implementation of PLM systems in an integrated landscape where PLM is interacting with ERP and MES/MOM
* Experience with implementation of PLM systems that support multiple engineering domains, such as Product Engineering, Manufacturing Engineering and Service Engineering
* Expert level understanding of Teamcenter


 We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.
   

  

**We are Siemens**
 A collection of over 377,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality, and we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Bring your curiosity and creativity and help us shape tomorrow!
   

  

 We offer a comprehensive reward package which includes a competitive basic salary, bonus scheme, generous holiday allowance, pension, and private healthcare.
   

  

**Transform the everyday**

title: Solution Architect - SuccessFactors
description:
*Vill du vara en nyckelspelare i att vidareutveckla och driva HR-system i en organisation med starkt fokus på tillväxt och innovation? Vi söker nu en engagerad och kunnig SuccessFactors Solution Architect till en viktig ledarroll i vårt framåtriktade interna IT-team!*
**Om jobbet**
 Som SuccessFactors Solution Architect kommer du att ha en central roll i vår interna IT-organisation och arbeta nära HR-funktionen. Du kommer att bidra till att optimera och utveckla vår gruppgemensamma SuccessFactors-lösning med ett holistiskt perspektiv. Rollen innebär att du kommer att delta i strategiska diskussioner kring HR-teknologins framtida utveckling och säkerställa att vi som organisation aktivt drar nytta av den senaste teknologin. Du kommer att ha breda kontaktytor och arbeta i en miljö som värdesätter innovation och förbättring.
   

  

 Dina arbetsuppgifter kommer vara bland annat:
   

  

* Ansvara för den tekniska arkitekturen och driften av SuccessFactors
* Implementera och optimera processflöden och integrationer i SuccessFactors
* Vara kontaktperson och tekniskt stöd för HR och andra interna stakeholders
* Stötta och driva projekt för nyutveckling, implementering och uppgraderingar av SuccessFactors
* Utveckla integrationslösningar mot andra system (exempelvis ServiceNow eller lönesystem)
* Ansvara för konfiguration och implementation av ny funktionalitet
* Leda implementeringen av SuccessFactors cloud-releaser för att säkerställa att vi utnyttjar den senaste teknologin
* Ansvara för felsökning och problemlösning i SuccessFactors
* Säkerställa att systemet följer både interna och externa krav på säkerhet och regelefterlevnad


**Vem är du?**
 Följande kommer göra dig framgångsrik i denna tjänst:
   

  

* Akademisk examen inom IT eller motsvarande
* God tidigare erfarenhet som Solution Architect (Functional Architect) eller motsvarande roll med djupgående kunskap inom en eller flera av marknadens större HCM-plattformar, t.ex. SAP SuccessFactors, Workday eller Oracle HCM Cloud
* Experterfarenhet av konfigurering och god kunskap om samtliga moduler inom SuccessFactors (t.ex. Employee Central, Performance and Goal Management, Learning Management, etc.)
* God förståelse för integrationer och datamodeller inom HR-systemlandskap
* Erfarenhet av att samarbeta med olika intressenter och förmåga att kommunicera tekniska lösningar på ett enkelt och pedagogiskt sätt
* Erfarenhet av IT-projektledning
* Goda kunskaper i svenska och engelska i både tal och skrift


 Meriterande är även om du har:
   

  

* Certifieringar inom SuccessFactors
* Grundläggande förståelse för SAP’s integrationsplattform CPI
* Erfarenhet av IT-projektledning


 Som person har du en stark analytisk förmåga och kan se helheten i komplexa IT-system och HR-processer. Du är självständig och leveranssäker i ditt arbete med lätt för såväl reaktiv som proaktiv problemlösning. Ditt team lägger stort fokus på innovation och utveckling och vi ser därför gärna att du delar vårt intresse för att se möjligheter i varje process.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi erbjuder en spännande och senior roll i en organisation som värdesätter innovation och förbättring. Du får möjligheten att arbeta med de senaste HR-teknologierna i en miljö med starkt fokus på digitalisering. Vi erbjuder en inkluderande och tillitsbaserad arbetsmiljö där din kompetens och erfarenhet gör skillnad, samt goda möjligheter till kompetensutveckling och påverkan inom din roll.
   

  

**Mer information**
*Låter det spännande? Då vill vi veta mer om dig! Välkommen med din ansökan redan idag. Vi arbetar löpande med denna rekrytering och kan komma att tillsätta tjänsten innan sista ansökningsdag.*
**Sista ansökningsdag: 2025-04-02**

title: Installation Specialist
description:
Linköping, Sweden
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**

**Vad du kommer att göra på Elekta**


Är du en problemlösare med erfarenhet av tunghantering, elektronik och mekanik i kombination med mjukvara? Trivs du med att resa och arbeta nära kunden på ett lösningsorienterat sätt? Då kan rollen som Installationsspecialist vara något för dig!


I denna roll ingår du i Elektas division *Business Line Neuro Solutions* och arbetar med Elektas *Gammakniv*. Du får möjlighet att arbeta internationellt och ansvara för installationer på sjukhus runtom i världen. Installationsprocessen är uppdelad i två faser:

* Fas 1: Tunghantering och laddning av kobolt-60-källor
* Fas 2: Montering, installation och testning av systemet


Här arbetar du tvärdisciplinärt inom mekanik, elektronik och mjukvara. Dina arbetsuppgifter inkluderar bland annat:

* Montering av tung utrustning
* Installation och montering av system
* Fungera som länk mellan sjukhuspersonal och Elekta, eskalera uppkomna problem och säkerställa att dessa åtgärdas
* På sikt agera stöd och vägleda andra ingenjörer inom Elektas organisation
* Identifiera och genomföra förbättringar som ökar kundnöjdheten


Du utgår från Elektas kontor i Linköping och rapporterar till installationschefen.

**Rätt egenskaper**

* Du är kommunikativ och trivs med att samarbeta i team
* Du har ett öppet och prestigelöst förhållningssätt, anpassar dig till olika kulturer och löser problem på ett lösningsorienterat sätt
* Du är självgående och tar gärna eget initiativ, med ett strukturerat arbetssätt
* Du har inga problem med att resa i tjänsten och värdesätter kundnöjdhet högt

**Vad du tar med dig**

* Ingenjörsutbildning eller minst fem års dokumenterad erfarenhet av installations-/servicearbete
* B-körkort
* Flytande svenska och engelska i tal och skrift


Erfarenhet av minst ett av följande områden är meriterande:

* Medicinska system
* Montering av tunga maskiner (tunga lyft)
* Radioaktivt material och strålsäkerhet
* Automatiserade styrsystem
* Har du kunskap inom flera av dessa områden är det extra meriterande
* Det är också meriterande om du har erfarenhet av en resande tjänst

**Vad du får**


I den här rollen arbetar du för ett högre syfte – hopp för alla som drabbas av cancer och för att alla, oavsett var i världen de befinner sig, ska ha tillgång till den bästa cancervården. Utöver detta erbjuder Elekta en rad förmåner:

* 30 betalda semesterdagar per år, samt 4 extra Elekta-dagar per år (utöver röda dagar)
* Attraktivt premiebaserat pensionsprogram
* Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring
* Lunchförmån
* Bidrag till friskvårdsaktiviteter

**Rekryteringsprocess**


Vi ser fram emot att höra från dig! Vänligen sök tjänsten genom att klicka på “ansök”-knappen. Observera att vi **inte** tar emot ansökningar via e‑post. Urvalet sker löpande, så ansök gärna så snart som möjligt.

**Din kontakt på Elekta**


Vid frågor om rollen vänligen kontakta ansvarig Talent Acquisition Partner, Gustaf Ericson, på gustaf.ericson@elekta.com.**Vi är en arbetsgivare som värdesätter mångfald och inkludering**


Vi utvärderar kvalificerade sökande utan hänsyn till ålder, ras, hudfärg, religion, kön, sexuell läggning, könsidentitet eller könsuttryck, genetisk information, nationalitet, funktionsvariation, veteranstatus eller någon annan status som skyddas enligt lag i de länder där Elekta är verksamt.

***Om Elekta/About Elekta***

*As a leader in precision radiation therapy, Elekta is committed to ensuring every patient has access to the best cancer care possible. Elekta is a proud innovator and supplier of equipment and software used to improve, prolong, and save the lives of people with cancer and brain disorders.*

*More than 6,000 hospitals worldwide rely on Elekta technology. We openly collaborate with customers to advance sustainable, outcome-driven, and cost-efficient solutions to meet evolving patient needs, improve lives, and bring hope to everyone dealing with cancer. To us, it’s personal, and our global team of 4,700 employees combines passion, science, and imagination to profoundly change cancer care.* ***We don’t just build technology, we build hope.***

*Elekta is headquartered in Stockholm, Sweden, with a presence in more than 120 countries and listed on Nasdaq Stockholm. For more information, visit* *elekta.com* *or follow @Elekta on Twitter and on LinkedIn.*

title: Test Engineer Automotive
description:
Sweden Mechatronics Gothenburg Hybrid
We are on the hunt for Test Engineers with automotive experience to work with industry-leading clients on the next generation of mobility solutions!

  


About The Member Company
We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:


* Technology & Engineering
* Energy & Renewables
* Life sciences & Pharma
* Digital & IT
**About this vacancy**
----------------------


You will be responsible for conducting test engineering activities across multiple abstraction layers, including component, system, and complete vehicle function levels. Your work will involve test analysis, planning, method definition, and execution, ensuring high-quality testing processes and results.


Key Responsibilities:

* Perform test execution in various environments, such as HIL, SIL, VIL, and real-world vehicle testing.
* Take responsibility for fault tracing, administrative traceability, and coverage analysis.
* Collaborate across different test infrastructures and support integration and technical alignment.
* Work with test assets, including Boxcar, CANalyzer, CANoe, INCA, DSA, CarConfig, and CarCom.
* Ensure the readiness and quality of test processes and support agile working methodologies.


**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


An Employneur that is a collaborative team player who believes in the power of positive influence. Embracing change, you continually seek innovative and improved approaches to tasks. Experience within any below is desirable:

* 2+ years of experience in test engineering within the automotive industry.
* Experience in component, domain, and complete vehicle testing.
* Proficiency with test tools such as CANalyzer, CANoe, INCA, DSA.
* Strong skills in fault tracing and troubleshooting.
* Fluent in English.


Meritorious Qualifications:

* Experience in embedded software development, including proficiency in C, Python, MATLAB, TargetLink, or Ascet.
* A hands-on mindset—you're not afraid to get involved in practical testing and troubleshooting.
* A genuine passion for the automotive industry and a strong drive to stay at the forefront of its technological advancements.


**What you can expect from us**
-------------------------------


In the role as an Employeneur, you will have the opportunity to both develop your technical skills and drive your own growth and business. We place great emphasis on your personal commitment and your willingness to advance your development. To support you with this, you will have the chance to influence the type of projects you take and the professional development you want to invest in. In other words, you are in control of your career.

  

Since TMC is an international company, we can offer projects in various locations across different countries where we and our clients operate. Currently, we are represented in Sweden, the Netherlands, Belgium, France, Luxembourg, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Hungary, the U.A.E., the USA, and Canada. The world is your workplace!


The 5 basic principles of **employeneurship**
A long-term working relationship
Enjoy the security of a long-term contract and a stable source of income while getting the opportunity to work at diverse projects.


Individual profit sharing
Full transparency. That’s it. For each of your projects, you know your hourly rate, your costs, and your individual performance-based profit sharing, all in order to stimulate your inner entrepreneur.


Business cells
Our employeneurs are grouped in business cells based on their technical expertise. They are small, focused and function as high-grade knowledge networks. And as buzzing communities of close colleagues.


YOUniversity
Every employeneur drives their own career. Together, we make a plan for personal and professional growth. Receive personal coaching and an extensive training budget to keep developing yourself and deliver outperformance at our clients.

  

The Entrepreneurial Lab
Work on your technical dreams in our lab. Collaborate with others in multidisciplinary teams to unlock out-of-the-box thinking and innovative ideas as well as entrepreneurial skills.

title: Validation and Verification Engineer
description:
**Bring more to life.**


Are you ready to accelerate your potential and make a real difference within life sciences, diagnostics and biotechnology?


At Cytiva, one of Danaher’s 15+ operating companies, our work saves lives—and we’re all united by a shared commitment to innovate for tangible impact.


You’ll thrive in a culture of belonging where you and your unique viewpoint matter. And by harnessing Danaher’s system of continuous improvement, you help turn ideas into impact – innovating at the speed of life.


Working at Cytiva means being at the forefront of providing new solutions to transform human health. Our incredible customers undertake life-saving activities ranging from fundamental biological research to developing innovative vaccines, new medicines, and cell and gene therapies.


At Cytiva you will be able to continuously improve yourself and us – working on challenges that truly matter with people that care for each other, our customers, and their patients. Take your next step to an altogether life-changing career.


Learn about the Danaher Business System which makes everything possible.


The **Validation and Verification Engineer** is responsible for planning and execution of functional test of our custom hardware products in customer projects.


This position reports to the Sr Manager Verification and is part of the Custom Engineering department Verification team located in Uppsala and will be an on-site role.

**What you will do:**

* Plan and execute functional test of custom hardware products.
* Review and reject/approve test results and to check and approve/reject other test engineers test protocols and documentation.
* Develop and write procedures for functional testing, perform troubleshooting and suggest corrective actions.
* Educate suppliers, customers and service engineers as well as participate in technical discussions and customers FAT.

**Who you are:**

* BSc degree or equivalent, preferably within electrical engineering. Alternatively, you have a comparable level of work life experience.
* High technical competence and deep understanding of control software.
* Fluency in English, both written and spoken.

**It would be a plus if you also possess previous experience in:**

* Knowledge of Cytiva Bioprocess products.
* Experience from testing/verification of operating systems.
* Experience from GMP and/or other regulated business areas.
* Fluency in Swedish, both written and spoken.


To be successful in this role, we believe that you are a structured, analytical person with a excellent team-working skills. We believe that you are an energized and results-oriented self-starter.

**Application**


We continuously assess candidates and invite them for interviews, so please don’t hesitate to write and send in the application. The recruitment will be completed as soon as a suitable candidate is found


We look forward to seeing your application.


Join our winning team today. Together, we’ll accelerate the real-life impact of tomorrow’s science and technology. We partner with customers across the globe to help them solve their most complex challenges, architecting solutions that bring the power of science to life.


For more information, visit www.danaher.com.


At Danaher, we value diversity and the existence of similarities and differences, both visible and not, found in our workforce, workplace and throughout the markets we serve. Our associates, customers and shareholders contribute unique and different perspectives as a result of these diverse attributes.
company_description: Cytiva is a global provider of technologies and services that advance and accelerate the development and manufacture of therapeutics, addressing urgent needs and helping save patient lives.

title: Service Engineer- Brake
description:
**Discover your potential. Pursue your passion.**
Link Engineering Company (LINK) is a premier designer and manufacturer of precision test equipment, we specialize in developing customized solutions for Automotive, Aviation, Off-Highway, Rail and Civil Engineering industries. We are headquartered in Plymouth, Michigan, and maintain testing laboratories, manufacturing, and support facilities around the globe.
Established in 1935, we have been a family-owned company for generations, we treat our customers and employees as if they are part of our family. We set our employees up for success, as they are given constant opportunities to learn and develop new skills. As many of our team members have been with LINK for a generation or more, the LINK team is equipped with a wealth of knowledge, providing decades of hands-on experience and out-of-the-box thinking to OEMs and suppliers everywhere.  

  

We are looking for a Service Engineer/Technicianresponsible for the activities related to Field Service ( Repair,Software Support, Calibration and Preventive Maintenance), Parts ( Sales and Repair) and Equipment Commissioning for our customers based in Europe.  

**ACTIVITY**
* Independent commissioning, maintenance and calibration of brake testers and other test bench systems
* Fault analyses and repairs of all LINK systems and devices
* Support in the further development of our products through experience reports to product and service management


**PROFIL**
* Technician/master craftsman, engineering degree specializing in electrical engineering/mechatronics/mechanical engineering
* Power electronics technician with relevant professional experience in the service environment is also welcome
* Several years of experience in a comparable position, ideally knowledge in the field of brakes
* Knowledge of MS Office
* Fluent in English
* Customer and service-orientated appearance and corresponding work attitude
* High level of stress resistance
* Strong willingness to cooperate and ability to work in a team
* Willingness to travel, mainly Europe


**WE OFFER**
* Career prospects in an international and dynamic company with a well-known tradition of quality and competence
* Varied and technically complex work content with high added value.
* International customers operating in Europe
* Professional and economic growth combined with acquired skills
* Technical training
* Good working atmosphere
* Attractive salary with flexible working hours and high job security
* Permanent employment contract
company_addresses: 41100 Plymouth Rd Suite 300, Plymouth, MI, United States, Michigan

title: Process Engineer
description:
Cleeven is an Engineering and R&D consulting group supporting clients in their R&D efforts and operational excellence. We bring expertise in innovation and process development across a wide range of industries, including energy, pharmaceuticals & chemicals, aerospace & defense, transportation, IT & telecoms, and more.
  
We are currently seeking skilled and motivated Process Engineers to join our team. As a Process Engineer, you will be responsible for optimizing and developing chemical and industrial processes, ensuring efficiency, sustainability, and compliance with industry standards. You will collaborate with multidisciplinary teams to drive innovation and continuous improvement in production environments.
  
  

**Your Responsibilities:**  

Developing, optimizing, and implementing chemical and industrial processes
  
Creating and updating Process Flow Diagrams (PFDs) and Piping & Instrumentation Diagrams (P&IDs)
  
Conducting feasibility studies, process simulations, and technical assessments
  
Utilizing process modeling tools and simulation software for analysis and optimization
  
Collaborating with R&D and production teams to improve efficiency and sustainability
  
Ensuring compliance with safety, environmental, and industry regulations
  
Troubleshooting and resolving process-related issues in production
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Chemical Engineering, Process Engineering, or related field
  
Experience with process simulation and modeling tools such as Aspen Plus, HYSYS, or similar
  
Strong knowledge of PFD and P&ID development and industrial process design
  
Familiarity with engineering tools for fluid dynamics, heat transfer, and mass balance analysis
  
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
  
Ability to work in a team-oriented environment
  
Good communication and project management skills
  
We are currently recruiting two engineers—one junior and one senior.

title: DFT Engineer
description:
We are seeking a skilled and motivated DFT Engineer to join our team. The ideal candidate will have hands-on experience with Cadence tools and a strong background in implementing and optimizing Design for Testability strategies for complex semiconductor designs. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to enhance testability, reduce costs, and improve product quality through innovative DFT methodologies.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Develop and implement DFT strategies for advanced semiconductor designs using Cadence tools such as Modus DFT Software Solution.
  
  

Perform scan insertion, ATPG (Automatic Test Pattern Generation), and BIST (Built-In Self-Test) implementation.
  
  

Collaborate with design and verification teams to ensure seamless integration of DFT features into the design flow.
  
  

Optimize test coverage and efficiency while minimizing test costs and time-to-market.
  
  

Analyze test data to identify and resolve manufacturing test issues.
  
  

Generate and review DFT documentation, including test plans, specifications, and reports.
  
  

Support post-silicon validation and debug efforts.
  
  

Stay updated on industry trends and advancements in DFT methodologies and tools.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or a related field.
  
  

Proven experience in DFT, including scan insertion, ATPG, BIST, and boundary scan.
  
  

Proficiency with Cadence tools, particularly Modus DFT Software Solution.
  
  

Strong understanding of digital design, verification, and test principles.
  
  

Experience with scripting languages such as Python, Perl, or TCL is a plus.
  
  

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
  
  

Effective communication and teamwork skills.
  
  

**Preferred Skills:**  

Familiarity with low-power design and testing methodologies.
  
  

Knowledge of advanced fault models and diagnostics.
  
  

Experience with FinFET SRAMs and automotive safety applications.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
Opportunity to work on cutting-edge semiconductor technologies.
  
  

Collaborative and innovative work environment.
  
  

Competitive compensation and benefits package.

title: Lead Process Monitoring Engineer
description:
Job Description Summary
  
Are you passionate about cutting-edge technology and innovation? Do you want to be part of a team that's transforming industries with advanced metal additive manufacturing? If so, we have an exciting opportunity as Lead Process Monitoring Engineer for you at Colibrium Additive based in Gothenburg– a GE Aerospace company!
  
  

**Your Role:** As a Lead Process Monitoring Engineer, you will be at the forefront of designing and developing highly complex modules and critical components for our additive manufacturing technology. Your focus will be on Electron Beam Melting (EBM) machine technology, driving the design and development efforts related to process monitoring capabilities.
  
  

Job Description
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Design and develop signal processing solutions for in-situ sensor feedback integration in additive machines.
  
Acquire, analyze, and program sensor data to optimize additive manufacturing process parameters.
  
Integrate new sensor functions and modules into our product families.
  
Verify the functionality of new modules and features.
  
Develop user interfaces and applications using OpenCV, Python, C++, and C#.
  
Collaborate with customers to understand and meet their business needs.
  
Lead the in-situ monitoring roadmap, including organizing sensor technology IP and aligning with partners.
  
Define requirements for in-situ functions and modules with Product Management and stakeholders.
  
Conduct development testing and code reviews.
  
Continuously improve our processes and comply with project plans and industry standards.
  
  

**Required Qualifications:**  

Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or STEM majors (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math).
  
Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in software development with OpenCV, Python, C++, C#, or equivalent.
  
Proven experience in statistically validating analytics algorithm performance.
  
Knowledge and experience with Linux operating systems.
  
Prior experience in high-speed data analytics, image analysis, and sensor utilization.
  
Strong knowledge of git source control tools and best practices.
  
Experience working with containers (e.g., Docker).
  
  

**About Us:** Colibrium Additive - part of GE Aerospace- is a global leader in metal additive design and manufacturing. Our pioneering processes empower businesses to create innovative products that solve complex manufacturing challenges, improve outcomes, and make a positive impact on the world. Our state-of-the-art metal 3D printers are designed by our expert engineering teams, manufactured in Sweden and Germany, and used worldwide in industries such as aerospace, medical, and more.
  
  

Why Join Us?
  
**Innovative Environment:** Work with the most advanced metal 3D printers in the world.
  
**Global Collaboration:** Collaborate with colleagues in Germany, India, the US, and customers worldwide.
  
**Agile and Dynamic:** Enjoy the benefits of a smaller, agile company with the support of a global enterprise.
  
**Inclusive Culture:** Colibrium Additive is an Equal Opportunity Employer where inclusion matters.
  
**Work-Life Balance:** Flexible working arrangements and a positive work-life balance.
  
**Comprehensive Benefits:** Flexible working hours, health and pension insurance benefits, and more.
  
  

**Join Us and Make a Difference:** At GE Aerospace, we believe that our people make the difference. As a new joiner, you'll enjoy a fun, flexible, and technically advanced working environment. You'll gain valuable experience, interact with highly committed colleagues from different cultures, and contribute to your future development.
  
Ready to take the next step in your career? Apply now and be part of a team that's changing the world for the better!

title: Maps Services Lead Engineer
description:
**Summary**  

  

Posted: Dec 20, 2024
  

  

Weekly Hours: **37.5**
  

  

Role Number:**200583487**  

  

Are you a self-starter looking for an exciting career opportunity? Do you like to ship software solutions that impact Apple Maps users around the world? Are you passionate about leading complex software engineering work? A job at Apple is unlike any other you’ve had. You’ll be challenged, inspired, and you will be proud of your work. Maps are a significant part of our everyday lives. Whether you are selecting a fine restaurant for dinner with friends, finding public transit that gets you to the big game before kickoff, or looking for the nearest gas station, you are relying on services provided by the Maps Services Team. The Apple Maps Services team develop cutting-edge guidance products to constantly improve the navigation experience and help hundreds of millions of people every day with their driving, walking and public transit needs. The team is also responsible for generating the vector maps that powers the beautiful map display in Apple Maps. We are looking for a skilled lead software engineer, with a passion to take ownership of problems and deliverables, lead software engineering work, and to organise skilled engineers to deliver the next generation of display and navigation services for Apple Maps.
  

  

**Description**  

  

- Lead and drive the work of a team of remarkably skilled software engineers. - Be a strong advocate for the customer experience. - Take ownership of solving problems and deliver solutions on time. -Communicate and coordinate with teams and stakeholders in the US. - Participating in design and code reviews. - Influencing the future product direction.
  

  

**Minimum Qualifications**  

* Ability to take ownership, identify requirements, prioritise and make progress in an environment with limited given input.
* Very strong in leading others, and hands-on, in programming, system design and problem solving.
* Extensive, professional experience from software engineering.
* Fluent communication in English with a sense for listening to others as well as getting your message through in a crisp way.
* Experience in cross team collaboration and communication across multiple timezones.

  

**Preferred Qualifications**  

* Strong understanding of common data structures and basic graph algorithms.
* Mindset of writing efficient code, recognising that the "optimal solution" may not always be the most efficient if its impact is minimal.
* Experience in Scala, Python, Kotlin, and C++.
* Knowledge in Spark, Iceberg and spatial algorithms/problems.
* Experience from working in distributed engineering teams.
* Knowledge from the maps (GIS) domain, related to routing, navigation, traffic or display maps.
* Experience from the ML domain.

title: Embedded SW developer
description:
**The world needs more advanced code now more than ever.** 




 The future demands higher resolution and larger datasets - and it has to be fast!
 



 When speed is critical, running everything in software just won’t cut it. Advanced software is needed. That’s where BitSimNOW comes in. We have chosen to focus on imaging and data collection/data transmission, where clock frequencies, power consumption, resolution, or data transfer require that extra edge. However, we also work in other applications. Our customers in Sweden and abroad need help developing their imaging or data collection systems for applications in industry, defense, medical equipment, and automotive. We develop Electronics, Embedded Software, FPGA designs, and Vision/Machine Learning at the cutting edge of technology. We also develop our own FPGA IP for image processing/handling and data collection.
 



  





**Your Background** 




 We are looking for engineers—whether you have a degree or are a self-taught hacker.
 



 Do you have experience with:
 



 • Embedded SW C/C++, RUST, and embedded Linux
 



 • V4L and GStreamer
 



 • Bare metal or RTOS
 



 • The difference between UNIX and Linux?
 



 • Linux core components or libraries?
 



 • Curious about RUST, RISC V?
 



  





**Join our team – where you come first! 🌟** 




 We are a group of 40+ engineers with diverse expertise, experience, and skills. Here, you’ll find a place to grow, experiment, and thrive! We value innovation, community, and a non-hierarchical culture where everyone can be themselves. Naturally, we uphold strong values and provide a work environment where you feel appreciated.
 



  





**What we offer:** 




 ✅ Learning from experienced colleagues
 



 📚 Further education & development opportunities
 



 🔬 Own lab with 3D printers & development tools
 



 💡 Space for your ideas & projects
 



 🙌 A non-hierarchical culture – be yourself!
 



 🖥️ We love nerds and are still woke!
 



 📹 Love blogging/vlogging? We need your help!
 



  





 At BitSimNOW, our employees are our top priority. We strive to create a workplace where you can enjoy a healthy balance of work, fun, and free time. With us, you get flexibility and benefits that truly make a difference in your daily life, such as:
 



  





 ✅ Collective agreement (Almega TechSverige 2023–2025)
 



 💼 ITP occupational pension
 



 📈 Flexible pension
 



 💪 Wellness allowance
 



 🎿 Ski trips, conferences & excursions
 



 🍻 Afterworks & our own microbrewery
 



 🏌️‍♂️ Groups for padel, golf, floorball, etc.
 



  





**…and much more. Join our team! 🚀**

title: Backend Engineer
description:

title: Site Verification Developer
description:

**About this opportunity:**
 As the tech firm that created the mobile world, and with more than 54,000 patents to our name, we’ve made it our business to make a mark. When joining our team at Ericsson you are empowered to learn, lead, and perform at your best, shaping the future of technology.
   

  

 The Product Engineering Group (PEG) Site Solutions develops and maintains Ericsson Radio Site Solutions. Our responsibilities include enclosure systems, site power and energy systems, integrated site build solutions, installation and inter-connect solutions, smart site monitoring and management solutions. We seek new technologies and partners in the site area through vendor scouting, pre-development, and technology studies. Site Solutions collaborates globally to create holistic site solutions. Site Integrations (SI) provides expertise in HW-SW integration, including test management and verification during design and development.
   

  

 We are now looking for an Integration/Verification Developer within the Site Solution area, including power, battery back-up systems, controllers, enclosures, sensors, and other site equipment’s for our Radio Base sites! Your role will include I&V activities such as: writing verification specifications and test reports, integrate and verify site solutions, fault handling and TR writing, write scripts in Linux environment and develop tools.

* Perform trouble shooting both for Hardware and Software
* Handle tools development
* Run continuous improvements of products and processes
* Create test scripts

* Experience in integration and verification
* Experience in trouble shooting and customer support
* Experience in working with people and networking
* Experience in innovating, adapting and responding to change
* Experience to deliver results and meeting customer expectations
